      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When a new webpage loads that requires a form fill, often, even when the curser shows in the form field upon loading, when you begin to type, an autofill begins to show what you're typing, outside of the form field.  This only seems to occur when typing frequently used keystrings such as usernames and passwords. Interestingly as well, the passwords are usually hashed out in the form, but this bug shows them. <span class="line"><!---->When a new webpage loads that requires a form fill, often, even when the curser shows in the form field upon loading, when you begin to type, an autofill begins to show what you're typing, outside of the form field.  This only seems to occur when typing frequently used keystrings such as usernames and passwords. Interestingly as well, the passwords are usually hashed out in the form, but this bug shows them. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.134] +  (Official Build) (x86_64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.134] +  (Official Build) (x86_64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: [macOS Monterey version 12.5]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [macOS Monterey version 12.5]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: [BurkeDaniels]<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: [BurkeDaniels]<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Then you visit Clari and start typing "pas..." for the email field, and it shows "password123" as an option in the automatic dropdown.<span class="line"><!---->2. Then you visit Clari and start typing "pas..." for the email field, and it shows "password123" as an option in the automatic dropdown.<!----></span><br><br>Does that sound right? If so, I think what probably happened is that the other website you visited didn't use a password field where you put in "password123" so it saved it to recommend for the email field.<span class="line"><!---->Does that sound right?         Hello.  Perhaps I shouldn't have used the clari screenshot because that's a user name field.  This happens quite frequently on various sites, it just so happened i decied to screengrab that one and finally report it.  <span class="line"><!---->Hello.  Perhaps I shouldn't have used the clari screenshot because that's a user name field.  This happens quite frequently on various sites, it just so happened i decied to screengrab that one and finally report it.  <!----></span><br><br>I'd say this is a bug with two different problems.  The first is that, if you notice, the "recommended" is not actually showing up in the proper form field.  It's off to the side.  So even if it was recommending, say, the correct user name, if I arrow down to it and hit enter, it doesn't fill the form field.  That's an inconvenience bug.<span class="line"><!---->I'd say this is a bug with two different problems.  The first is that, if you notice, the "recommended" is not actually showing up in the proper form field.  It's off to the side.  So even if it was recommending, say, the correct user name, if I arrow down to it and hit enter, it doesn't fill the form field.  That's an inconvenience bug.<!----></span><br><br>From a security perspective, when this happens on a page that i'm filling in a password, where the password is typically hashed out in the form field.  It will show what i'm typing up in that "recommended" box that is incorrectly popping up over to the right.  So perhaps the "common keystroke" of the password isn't being saved which is good, it is showing it on screen rather than hashing out.  <span class="line"><!---->From a security perspective, when this happens on a page that i'm filling in a password, where the password is typically hashed out in the form field.         The page resembles <span class="line"><!---->The page resembles <!----></span>https://app.clari.com/signin<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://app.clari.com/signin"><!---->https://app.clari.com/signin<!----></a> but I cannot simulate a timeout. I suppose that this is due to some relayout issue.<span class="line"><!----> but I cannot simulate a timeout. I suppose that this is due to some relayout issue.<!----></span><br><br>The dropdown shown in the screenshot indicates that this is Chrome Autocomplete, which stores input data you have submitted on fields with the same name, which happens to be "email" in this case:<span class="line"><!---->The dropdown shown in the screenshot indicates that this is Chrome Autocomplete, which stores input data you have submitted on fields with the same name, which happens to be "email" in this case:<!----></span><br><br><input class="clari-clari-modal-Field-inputField" name="email" type="text" placeholder="<span class="line"><!---->&lt;input class="clari-clari-modal-Field-inputField" name="email" type="text" placeholder="<!----></span>email@example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:email@example.com"><!---->email@example.com<!----></a>" spellcheck="false" value=""><span class="line"><!---->" spellcheck="false" value=""&gt;<!----></span><br><br>This also explains why this happens on multiple pages.<span class="line"><!---->This also explains why this happens on multiple pages.<!----></span><br><br>The solution is to focus the input field, press the down cursor to focus the entry and then press Silft+Delete on a Mac.<span class="line"><!---->The solution is to focus the input field, press the down cursor to focus the entry and then press Silft+Delete on a Mac.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          display: flex;

          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>

            Issue 1351711: Security: common keystrokes, including passwords, being displayed outside of proper form fields
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1351711: Security: common keystrokes, including passwords, being displayed outside of proper form fields
          </h1>
          
            Reported by

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When a new webpage loads that requires a form fill, often, even when the curser shows in the form field upon loading, when you begin to type, an autofill begins to show what you're typing, outside of the form field.  This only seems to occur when typing frequently used keystrings such as usernames and passwords. Interestingly as well, the passwords are usually hashed out in the form, but this bug shows them. <span class="line"><!---->When a new webpage loads that requires a form fill, often, even when the curser shows in the form field upon loading, when you begin to type, an autofill begins to show what you're typing, outside of the form field.  This only seems to occur when typing frequently used keystrings such as usernames and passwords. Interestingly as well, the passwords are usually hashed out in the form, but this bug shows them. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.134] +  (Official Build) (x86_64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.134] +  (Official Build) (x86_64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: [macOS Monterey version 12.5]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [macOS Monterey version 12.5]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: [BurkeDaniels]<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: [BurkeDaniels]<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi danieljosephburke@, to make sure I understand what you're saying:<span class="line"><!---->Hi danieljosephburke@, to make sure I understand what you're saying:<!----></span><br>1. On some other website you typed in some password (let's say it's "password123")<span class="line"><!---->1. On some other website you typed in some password (let's say it's "password123")<!----></span><br>2. Then you visit Clari and start typing "pas..." for the email field, and it shows "password123" as an option in the automatic dropdown.<span class="line"><!---->2. Then you visit Clari and start typing "pas..." for the email field, and it shows "password123" as an option in the automatic dropdown.<!----></span><br><br>Does that sound right? If so, I think what probably happened is that the other website you visited didn't use a password field where you put in "password123" so it saved it to recommend for the email field.<span class="line"><!---->Does that sound right? If so, I think what probably happened is that the other website you visited didn't use a password field where you put in "password123" so it saved it to recommend for the email field.<!----></span><br><br>If you don't think this is the case, please include reproduction details of typing in a password in a password field that is later recommended in a visible field.<span class="line"><!---->If you don't think this is the case, please include reproduction details of typing in a password in a password field that is later recommended in a visible field.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello.  Perhaps I shouldn't have used the clari screenshot because that's a user name field.  This happens quite frequently on various sites, it just so happened i decied to screengrab that one and finally report it.  <span class="line"><!---->Hello.  Perhaps I shouldn't have used the clari screenshot because that's a user name field.  This happens quite frequently on various sites, it just so happened i decied to screengrab that one and finally report it.  <!----></span><br><br>I'd say this is a bug with two different problems.  The first is that, if you notice, the "recommended" is not actually showing up in the proper form field.  It's off to the side.  So even if it was recommending, say, the correct user name, if I arrow down to it and hit enter, it doesn't fill the form field.  That's an inconvenience bug.<span class="line"><!---->I'd say this is a bug with two different problems.  The first is that, if you notice, the "recommended" is not actually showing up in the proper form field.  It's off to the side.  So even if it was recommending, say, the correct user name, if I arrow down to it and hit enter, it doesn't fill the form field.  That's an inconvenience bug.<!----></span><br><br>From a security perspective, when this happens on a page that i'm filling in a password, where the password is typically hashed out in the form field.  It will show what i'm typing up in that "recommended" box that is incorrectly popping up over to the right.  So perhaps the "common keystroke" of the password isn't being saved which is good, it is showing it on screen rather than hashing out.  <span class="line"><!---->From a security perspective, when this happens on a page that i'm filling in a password, where the password is typically hashed out in the form field.  It will show what i'm typing up in that "recommended" box that is incorrectly popping up over to the right.  So perhaps the "common keystroke" of the password isn't being saved which is good, it is showing it on screen rather than hashing out.  <!----></span><br><br>I tried adding a .mov file to show you, but it's past the 10 MB per comment limit.<span class="line"><!---->I tried adding a .mov file to show you, but it's past the 10 MB per comment limit.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        So far this looks to me like either<span class="line"><!---->So far this looks to me like either<!----></span><br>- the focus is in a hidden field or<span class="line"><!---->- the focus is in a hidden field or<!----></span><br>- the email field is focused but the dropdown is positioned incorrectly.<span class="line"><!---->- the email field is focused but the dropdown is positioned incorrectly.<!----></span><br><br>I can't find this Clari website. Could you provide another reproduction URL when you encounter the issue?<span class="line"><!---->I can't find this Clari website. Could you provide another reproduction URL when you encounter the issue?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        The page resembles <span class="line"><!---->The page resembles <!----></span>https://app.clari.com/signin<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://app.clari.com/signin"><!---->https://app.clari.com/signin<!----></a> but I cannot simulate a timeout. I suppose that this is due to some relayout issue.<span class="line"><!----> but I cannot simulate a timeout. I suppose that this is due to some relayout issue.<!----></span><br><br>The dropdown shown in the screenshot indicates that this is Chrome Autocomplete, which stores input data you have submitted on fields with the same name, which happens to be "email" in this case:<span class="line"><!---->The dropdown shown in the screenshot indicates that this is Chrome Autocomplete, which stores input data you have submitted on fields with the same name, which happens to be "email" in this case:<!----></span><br><br><input class="clari-clari-modal-Field-inputField" name="email" type="text" placeholder="<span class="line"><!---->&lt;input class="clari-clari-modal-Field-inputField" name="email" type="text" placeholder="<!----></span>email@example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:email@example.com"><!---->email@example.com<!----></a>" spellcheck="false" value=""><span class="line"><!---->" spellcheck="false" value=""&gt;<!----></span><br><br>This also explains why this happens on multiple pages.<span class="line"><!---->This also explains why this happens on multiple pages.<!----></span><br><br>The solution is to focus the input field, press the down cursor to focus the entry and then press Silft+Delete on a Mac.<span class="line"><!---->The solution is to focus the input field, press the down cursor to focus the entry and then press Silft+Delete on a Mac.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by danie...@gmail.com (Aug 10, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When a new webpage loads that requires a form fill, often, even when the curser shows in the form field upon loading, when you begin to type, an autofill begins to show what you're typing, outside of the form field.  This only seems to occur when typing frequently used keystrings such as usernames and passwords. Interestingly as well, the passwords are usually hashed out in the form, but this bug shows them. <span class="line"><!---->When a new webpage loads that requires a form fill, often, even when the curser shows in the form field upon loading, when you begin to type, an autofill begins to show what you're typing, outside of the form field.  This only seems to occur when typing frequently used keystrings such as usernames and passwords. Interestingly as well, the passwords are usually hashed out in the form, but this bug shows them. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.134] +  (Official Build) (x86_64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.134] +  (Official Build) (x86_64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: [macOS Monterey version 12.5]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [macOS Monterey version 12.5]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: [BurkeDaniels]<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: [BurkeDaniels]<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi danieljosephburke@, to make sure I understand what you're saying:<span class="line"><!---->Hi danieljosephburke@, to make sure I understand what you're saying:<!----></span><br>1. On some other website you typed in some password (let's say it's "password123")<span class="line"><!---->1. On some other website you typed in some password (let's say it's "password123")<!----></span><br>2. Then you visit Clari and start typing "pas..." for the email field, and it shows "password123" as an option in the automatic dropdown.<span class="line"><!---->2. Then you visit Clari and start typing "pas..." for the email field, and it shows "password123" as an option in the automatic dropdown.<!----></span><br><br>Does that sound right? If so, I think what probably happened is that the other website you visited didn't use a password field where you put in "password123" so it saved it to recommend for the email field.<span class="line"><!---->Does that sound right? If so, I think what probably happened is that the other website you visited didn't use a password field where you put in "password123" so it saved it to recommend for the email field.<!----></span><br><br>If you don't think this is the case, please include reproduction details of typing in a password in a password field that is later recommended in a visible field.<span class="line"><!---->If you don't think this is the case, please include reproduction details of typing in a password in a password field that is later recommended in a visible field.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello.  Perhaps I shouldn't have used the clari screenshot because that's a user name field.  This happens quite frequently on various sites, it just so happened i decied to screengrab that one and finally report it.  <span class="line"><!---->Hello.  Perhaps I shouldn't have used the clari screenshot because that's a user name field.  This happens quite frequently on various sites, it just so happened i decied to screengrab that one and finally report it.  <!----></span><br><br>I'd say this is a bug with two different problems.  The first is that, if you notice, the "recommended" is not actually showing up in the proper form field.  It's off to the side.  So even if it was recommending, say, the correct user name, if I arrow down to it and hit enter, it doesn't fill the form field.  That's an inconvenience bug.<span class="line"><!---->I'd say this is a bug with two different problems.  The first is that, if you notice, the "recommended" is not actually showing up in the proper form field.  It's off to the side.  So even if it was recommending, say, the correct user name, if I arrow down to it and hit enter, it doesn't fill the form field.  That's an inconvenience bug.<!----></span><br><br>From a security perspective, when this happens on a page that i'm filling in a password, where the password is typically hashed out in the form field.  It will show what i'm typing up in that "recommended" box that is incorrectly popping up over to the right.  So perhaps the "common keystroke" of the password isn't being saved which is good, it is showing it on screen rather than hashing out.  <span class="line"><!---->From a security perspective, when this happens on a page that i'm filling in a password, where the password is typically hashed out in the form field.  It will show what i'm typing up in that "recommended" box that is incorrectly popping up over to the right.  So perhaps the "common keystroke" of the password isn't being saved which is good, it is showing it on screen rather than hashing out.  <!----></span><br><br>I tried adding a .mov file to show you, but it's past the 10 MB per comment limit.<span class="line"><!---->I tried adding a .mov file to show you, but it's past the 10 MB per comment limit.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The page resembles <span class="line"><!---->The page resembles <!----></span>https://app.clari.com/signin<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://app.clari.com/signin"><!---->https://app.clari.com/signin<!----></a> but I cannot simulate a timeout. I suppose that this is due to some relayout issue.<span class="line"><!----> but I cannot simulate a timeout. I suppose that this is due to some relayout issue.<!----></span><br><br>The dropdown shown in the screenshot indicates that this is Chrome Autocomplete, which stores input data you have submitted on fields with the same name, which happens to be "email" in this case:<span class="line"><!---->The dropdown shown in the screenshot indicates that this is Chrome Autocomplete, which stores input data you have submitted on fields with the same name, which happens to be "email" in this case:<!----></span><br><br><input class="clari-clari-modal-Field-inputField" name="email" type="text" placeholder="<span class="line"><!---->&lt;input class="clari-clari-modal-Field-inputField" name="email" type="text" placeholder="<!----></span>email@example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:email@example.com"><!---->email@example.com<!----></a>" spellcheck="false" value=""><span class="line"><!---->" spellcheck="false" value=""&gt;<!----></span><br><br>This also explains why this happens on multiple pages.<span class="line"><!---->This also explains why this happens on multiple pages.<!----></span><br><br>The solution is to focus the input field, press the down cursor to focus the entry and then press Silft+Delete on a Mac.<span class="line"><!---->The solution is to focus the input field, press the down cursor to focus the entry and then press Silft+Delete on a Mac.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When a new webpage loads that requires a form fill, often, even when the curser shows in the form field upon loading, when you begin to type, an autofill begins to show what you're typing, outside of the form field.  This only seems to occur when typing frequently used keystrings such as usernames and passwords. Interestingly as well, the passwords are usually hashed out in the form, but this bug shows them. <span class="line"><!---->When a new webpage loads that requires a form fill, often, even when the curser shows in the form field upon loading, when you begin to type, an autofill begins to show what you're typing, outside of the form field.  This only seems to occur when typing frequently used keystrings such as usernames and passwords. Interestingly as well, the passwords are usually hashed out in the form, but this bug shows them. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.134] +  (Official Build) (x86_64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.134] +  (Official Build) (x86_64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: [macOS Monterey version 12.5]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [macOS Monterey version 12.5]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: [BurkeDaniels]<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: [BurkeDaniels]<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi danieljosephburke@, to make sure I understand what you're saying:<span class="line"><!---->Hi danieljosephburke@, to make sure I understand what you're saying:<!----></span><br>1. On some other website you typed in some password (let's say it's "password123")<span class="line"><!---->1. On some other website you typed in some password (let's say it's "password123")<!----></span><br>2. Then you visit Clari and start typing "pas..." for the email field, and it shows "password123" as an option in the automatic dropdown.<span class="line"><!---->2. Then you visit Clari and start typing "pas..." for the email field, and it shows "password123" as an option in the automatic dropdown.<!----></span><br><br>Does that sound right? If so, I think what probably happened is that the other website you visited didn't use a password field where you put in "password123" so it saved it to recommend for the email field.<span class="line"><!---->Does that sound right? If so, I think what probably happened is that the other website you visited didn't use a password field where you put in "password123" so it saved it to recommend for the email field.<!----></span><br><br>If you don't think this is the case, please include reproduction details of typing in a password in a password field that is later recommended in a visible field.<span class="line"><!---->If you don't think this is the case, please include reproduction details of typing in a password in a password field that is later recommended in a visible field.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello.  Perhaps I shouldn't have used the clari screenshot because that's a user name field.  This happens quite frequently on various sites, it just so happened i decied to screengrab that one and finally report it.  <span class="line"><!---->Hello.  Perhaps I shouldn't have used the clari screenshot because that's a user name field.  This happens quite frequently on various sites, it just so happened i decied to screengrab that one and finally report it.  <!----></span><br><br>I'd say this is a bug with two different problems.  The first is that, if you notice, the "recommended" is not actually showing up in the proper form field.  It's off to the side.  So even if it was recommending, say, the correct user name, if I arrow down to it and hit enter, it doesn't fill the form field.  That's an inconvenience bug.<span class="line"><!---->I'd say this is a bug with two different problems.  The first is that, if you notice, the "recommended" is not actually showing up in the proper form field.  It's off to the side.  So even if it was recommending, say, the correct user name, if I arrow down to it and hit enter, it doesn't fill the form field.  That's an inconvenience bug.<!----></span><br><br>From a security perspective, when this happens on a page that i'm filling in a password, where the password is typically hashed out in the form field.  It will show what i'm typing up in that "recommended" box that is incorrectly popping up over to the right.  So perhaps the "common keystroke" of the password isn't being saved which is good, it is showing it on screen rather than hashing out.  <span class="line"><!---->From a security perspective, when this happens on a page that i'm filling in a password, where the password is typically hashed out in the form field.  It will show what i'm typing up in that "recommended" box that is incorrectly popping up over to the right.  So perhaps the "common keystroke" of the password isn't being saved which is good, it is showing it on screen rather than hashing out.  <!----></span><br><br>I tried adding a .mov file to show you, but it's past the 10 MB per comment limit.<span class="line"><!---->I tried adding a .mov file to show you, but it's past the 10 MB per comment limit.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 4<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1351711#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        The page resembles <span class="line"><!---->The page resembles <!----></span>https://app.clari.com/signin<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://app.clari.com/signin"><!---->https://app.clari.com/signin<!----></a> but I cannot simulate a timeout. I suppose that this is due to some relayout issue.<span class="line"><!----> but I cannot simulate a timeout. I suppose that this is due to some relayout issue.<!----></span><br><br>The dropdown shown in the screenshot indicates that this is Chrome Autocomplete, which stores input data you have submitted on fields with the same name, which happens to be "email" in this case:<span class="line"><!---->The dropdown shown in the screenshot indicates that this is Chrome Autocomplete, which stores input data you have submitted on fields with the same name, which happens to be "email" in this case:<!----></span><br><br><input class="clari-clari-modal-Field-inputField" name="email" type="text" placeholder="<span class="line"><!---->&lt;input class="clari-clari-modal-Field-inputField" name="email" type="text" placeholder="<!----></span>email@example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:email@example.com"><!---->email@example.com<!----></a>" spellcheck="false" value=""><span class="line"><!---->" spellcheck="false" value=""&gt;<!----></span><br><br>This also explains why this happens on multiple pages.<span class="line"><!---->This also explains why this happens on multiple pages.<!----></span><br><br>The solution is to focus the input field, press the down cursor to focus the entry and then press Silft+Delete on a Mac.<span class="line"><!---->The solution is to focus the input field, press the down cursor to focus the entry and then press Silft+Delete on a Mac.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<b class="line"><!---->This template is ONLY for reporting security bugs. If you are reporting a<!----></b><br>Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<b class="line"><!---->Download Protection Bypass bug, please use the "Security - Download<!----></b><br>Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<b class="line"><!---->Protection" template. For all other reports, please use a different<!----></b><br>template.<b class="line"><!---->template.<!----></b><br><br>Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<b class="line"><!---->Please READ THIS FAQ before filing a bug: https://chromium.googlesource.com<!----></b><br>/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<b class="line"><!---->/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/security/faq.md<!----></b><br><br>Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<b class="line"><!---->Please see the following link for instructions on filing security bugs:<!----></b><br>https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<b class="line"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/Home/chromium-security/reporting-security-bugs<!----></b><br><br>Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<b class="line"><!---->Reports may be eligible for reward payments under the Chrome VRP:<!----></b><br>http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<b class="line"><!---->http://g.co/ChromeBugRewards<!----></b><br><br>NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<b class="line"><!---->NOTE: Security bugs are normally made public once a fix has been widely<!----></b><br>deployed.<b class="line"><!---->deployed.<!----></b><br><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b><br><br>VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>When a new webpage loads that requires a form fill, often, even when the curser shows in the form field upon loading, when you begin to type, an autofill begins to show what you're typing, outside of the form field.  This only seems to occur when typing frequently used keystrings such as usernames and passwords. Interestingly as well, the passwords are usually hashed out in the form, but this bug shows them. <span class="line"><!---->When a new webpage loads that requires a form fill, often, even when the curser shows in the form field upon loading, when you begin to type, an autofill begins to show what you're typing, outside of the form field.  This only seems to occur when typing frequently used keystrings such as usernames and passwords. Interestingly as well, the passwords are usually hashed out in the form, but this bug shows them. <!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.134] +  (Official Build) (x86_64)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: [103.0.5060.134] +  (Official Build) (x86_64)<!----></span><br>Operating System: [macOS Monterey version 12.5]<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: [macOS Monterey version 12.5]<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<b class="line"><!---->Please include a demonstration of the security bug, such as an attached<!----></b><br>HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<b class="line"><!---->HTML or binary file that reproduces the bug when loaded in Chrome. PLEASE<!----></b><br>make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<b class="line"><!---->make the file as small as possible and remove any content not required to<!----></b><br>demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<b class="line"><!---->demonstrate the bug, or any personal or confidential information.<!----></b><br><br>Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<b class="line"><!---->Please attach files directly, not in zip or other archive formats, and if<!----></b><br>you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<b class="line"><!---->you've created a demonstration site please also attach the files needed to<!----></b><br>reproduce the demonstration locally.<b class="line"><!---->reproduce the demonstration locally.<!----></b><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<b class="line"><!---->Type of crash: [tab, browser, etc.]<!----></b><br>Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<b class="line"><!---->Crash State: [see link above: stack trace *with symbols*, registers,<!----></b><br>exception record]<b class="line"><!---->exception record]<!----></b><br>Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<b class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): [see link above]<!----></b><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<b class="line"><!---->Externally reported security bugs may appear in Chrome release notes. If<!----></b><br>this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<b class="line"><!---->this bug is included, how would you like to be credited?<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: [BurkeDaniels]<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: [BurkeDaniels]<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi danieljosephburke@, to make sure I understand what you're saying:<span class="line"><!---->Hi danieljosephburke@, to make sure I understand what you're saying:<!----></span><br>1. On some other website you typed in some password (let's say it's "password123")<span class="line"><!---->1. On some other website you typed in some password (let's say it's "password123")<!----></span><br>2. Then you visit Clari and start typing "pas..." for the email field, and it shows "password123" as an option in the automatic dropdown.<span class="line"><!---->2. Then you visit Clari and start typing "pas..." for the email field, and it shows "password123" as an option in the automatic dropdown.<!----></span><br><br>Does that sound right? If so, I think what probably happened is that the other website you visited didn't use a password field where you put in "password123" so it saved it to recommend for the email field.<span class="line"><!---->Does that sound right? If so, I think what probably happened is that the other website you visited didn't use a password field where you put in "password123" so it saved it to recommend for the email field.<!----></span><br><br>If you don't think this is the case, please include reproduction details of typing in a password in a password field that is later recommended in a visible field.<span class="line"><!---->If you don't think this is the case, please include reproduction details of typing in a password in a password field that is later recommended in a visible field.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello.  Perhaps I shouldn't have used the clari screenshot because that's a user name field.  This happens quite frequently on various sites, it just so happened i decied to screengrab that one and finally report it.  <span class="line"><!---->Hello.  Perhaps I shouldn't have used the clari screenshot because that's a user name field.  This happens quite frequently on various sites, it just so happened i decied to screengrab that one and finally report it.  <!----></span><br><br>I'd say this is a bug with two different problems.  The first is that, if you notice, the "recommended" is not actually showing up in the proper form field.  It's off to the side.  So even if it was recommending, say, the correct user name, if I arrow down to it and hit enter, it doesn't fill the form field.  That's an inconvenience bug.<span class="line"><!---->I'd say this is a bug with two different problems.  The first is that, if you notice, the "recommended" is not actually showing up in the proper form field.  It's off to the side.  So even if it was recommending, say, the correct user name, if I arrow down to it and hit enter, it doesn't fill the form field.  That's an inconvenience bug.<!----></span><br><br>From a security perspective, when this happens on a page that i'm filling in a password, where the password is typically hashed out in the form field.  It will show what i'm typing up in that "recommended" box that is incorrectly popping up over to the right.  So perhaps the "common keystroke" of the password isn't being saved which is good, it is showing it on screen rather than hashing out.  <span class="line"><!---->From a security perspective, when this happens on a page that i'm filling in a password, where the password is typically hashed out in the form field.         The page resembles <span class="line"><!---->The page resembles <!----></span>https://app.clari.com/signin<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://app.clari.com/signin"><!---->https://app.clari.com/signin<!----></a> but I cannot simulate a timeout. I suppose that this is due to some relayout issue.<span class="line"><!----> but I cannot simulate a timeout. I suppose that this is due to some relayout issue.<!----></span><br><br>The dropdown shown in the screenshot indicates that this is Chrome Autocomplete, which stores input data you have submitted on fields with the same name, which happens to be "email" in this case:<span class="line"><!---->The dropdown shown in the screenshot indicates that this is Chrome Autocomplete, which stores input data you have submitted on fields with the same name, which happens to be "email" in this case:<!----></span><br><br><input class="clari-clari-modal-Field-inputField" name="email" type="text" placeholder="<span class="line"><!---->&lt;input class="clari-clari-modal-Field-inputField" name="email" type="text" placeholder="<!----></span>email@example.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:email@example.com"><!---->email@example.com<!----></a>" spellcheck="false" value=""><span class="line"><!---->" spellcheck="false" value=""&gt;<!----></span><br><br>This also explains why this happens on multiple pages.<span class="line"><!---->This also explains why this happens on multiple pages.<!----></span><br><br>The solution is to focus the input field, press the down cursor to focus the entry and then press Silft+Delete on a Mac.<span class="line"><!---->The solution is to focus the input field, press the down cursor to focus the entry and then press Silft+Delete on a Mac.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      </button>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
